authors: Connor AKA the prettiest girl at the party

default: (a) a {@item rapier|phb}, (b) a {@item scimitar|phb}, or (c) any {@filter simple weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon}
(a) a {@item diplomat's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item entertainer's pack|phb}
(a) a {@item costume clothes|phb|dancer's costume} or (b) an {@item arcane focus|phb}

fluff.name: The Dancer
entries: A youthful elf twirls in circles, watching with delight as the leaves on the ground follow her movements. Faced by two brigands, the would-be victim's bursts of motion turn into a flurry that leaves their attackers slack-jawed.

The light of the room dims, and the spotlights focus on the lightly dressed woman who makes her way across the stage. With a large smile, she moves effortless along with the music, filling everyone's hearts with joy and pushing them to stay determined in whatever challenges they have.

Dancers are masters of their own body. Through careful motion they may inflict dazzling attacks, or even manipulate the energy around them. The very environment is a weapon in a Dancer's hands. Sultry swayers of the night who are refined in the day, only in a tavern brawl would you ever see these graceful devil's show their true colors with a blade.

entries.name: Of Silk and Steel
entries: Dancers draw from many different sources and backgrounds, combining them into a single package which covers a wide variety of situations. Using small weapons to pick away at their unwitting foes as their dances debilitate their marks. Though a rarity on the battlefield, few forget the sight of a skilled dancer at work.

entries.name: The Power of Rhythm
entries: Dancers perform their magical feats not through a stave or rod, but rather through the rhythm and movement of their bodies. As they dance around the battlefield they move their bodies in specific patterns to manipulate the latent magical power within and to gather residual magic in the environment. Once they've gathered the required magic, they must keep moving to keep their spell active, channeling the magic further.

entries.name: Creating a Dancer
entries: Dancers are passionate people dedicated to their craft. Spending years practicing has gifted them with the ability to weave spells and their passions together into a gorgeous display of skill. When creating a Dancer, you must consider where they have honed their craft.

Did they pick up the profession naturally, teaching themselves over long hours, or did they study beneath some kind of mentor? One must consider their motivations, does your Dancer seek fame and fortune, or do they want to bring the gifts of joy to the masses. Perhaps they are going on their journey in an attempt to hone their craft even further. What drives your character to go beyond a normal dancer, and actually fight? Talk to your DM about the role dancers might have in your campaign's societies.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a dancer quickly by following these suggestions. First, Charisma should be your highest ability score, followed by Dexterity. Second, choose the {@background entertainer} background. Finally, choose a {@item rapier|phb}, 2 {@item daggers|phb|dagger}, an {@item entertainer's pack|phb}, and a {@item dancer's costume|phb|costume clothes}.

classFeature.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While you are wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Charisma modifier.

classFeature.name: Dancing Steps
entries: Your acrobatic and seductive movement allows you to move better than most. You can take a bonus action on each of your turns in combat. This bonus action can be used to take either the Dash or Disengage action.

classFeature.name: Expert Performer
entries: Your Proficiency Bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses Performance.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: At 2nd level, you have learned how to harness the power of your dancing, turning your wishes and wills into pure magic. See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} for the general rules of spellcasting and {@book chapter 11|PHB|11} for the {@filter bard spell list|spells|class=bard}.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Dancer table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher
entries: You know five 1st-level spells of your choice from the bard spell list.
The Spells Known column of the Dancer table shows when you learn more bard spells of your choice. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots, as shown on the table.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the dancer spells you know and replace it with another spell from the bard spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Dance Magic
entries: As a Dancer, when you cast a spell, you do not have to fulfill the verbal component of the spell. You must spend 10 feet of movement alongside your spell slot to cast a spell. Any effects that would drop your speed to 0 ft. will prevent you from casting spells.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your dancer spells. Your magic comes from the beauty and elegance of your dancing and movements. You use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a dancer spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use a {@item costume clostes|PHB|dancer's costume} as a spellcasting focus for your dancer spells.

classFeature.name: Dancing
entries: At 2nd level, your skills in the art of dancing and grace have given you special abilities, giving you one dance of your choice.

A list of the available dance options can be found on the {@filter Optional Features|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=Dance} page. When you gain certain dancer levels, you gain additional dances of your choice, as shown in the Dances column of the Dancer table.
Additionally, when you learn a new dance, you can choose one of the dances you know and replace it with another dance that you could learn at that level.

entries.name: Dances
entries: Dances have two parts: An active effect, and a passive effect. The passive effect stays in effect until the dance ends, which is when you use another dance, become incapacitated, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, or restrained, you take a short or long rest, or after a certain amount of time has passed, unless stated otherwise. Each active effect costs a spell slot of 1st level or higher to use. The amount of time that a dance lasts for is determined by the level of spell slot expended: 1st level -1 minute; 2nd level â€“ 10 minutes; 3rd level â€“ 1 hour; 4th level â€“ 8 hours; 5th level â€“ Until the dance ends by any of the qualifying conditions or triggers.

Some dances are complex enough to require a level of concentration to be maintained. This concentration functions the same as that of a spell, and as such, you must make concentration checks when injured and may not concentrate on both a dance and a spell that require concentration.

classFeature.name: Dancing College
entries: Beginning at 3rd level, you learn the graceful movements of a college of dancers of your choice. Your choice grants you features at 3rd, 5th, 10th, and 14th levels.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Dancing College feature
entries: At 5th level, you gain a feature from your Dancing College.

classFeature.name: Dancing Movement
entries: Beginning at 6th level, your speed increases by 10 feet while you aren't wearing heavy armor. At 14th level, your speed increases by an additional 5 feet under the same restriction.

classFeature.name: Nimble Contortions
entries: Starting at 7th level, when an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to halve the attack's damage against you.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Dancing College feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature from your Dancing College.

classFeature.name: Evasion
entries: Starting at 11th level, you can nimbly dodge out of the way of certain area effects, such as a red dragon's fiery breath or an ice storm spell. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

classFeature.name: Reliable Performance
entries: By 11th level, you have refined your dancing skills until they approach perfection. Whenever you make a Performance or another ability check that utilizes your mastery of dance, you can treat a d20 roll of 9 or lower, as a 10.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Untouched by Lust
entries: Starting at 13th level, your mind is so accustomed to the ways of seduction that you are immune to being charmed unless you choose not to be.
Additionally, when a creature would make a saving throw to resist being charmed by you, they make the saving throw with disadvantage.

classFeature.name: Dancing College feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature from your Dancing College.

classFeature.name: Fluidity of Body
entries: Starting at 15th level, your movements cause your body to be harder to hit when you are on the move. All opportunity attacks made against you have disadvantage.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Unhurt by Words
entries: By 18th level, due to all your time dealing with seducing words and criticism, you have grown a defense to them. You are completely immune to psychic-type damage, and your thoughts may only be detected or read if you choose to let them.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Godlike Beauty
entries: At 20th level, your body is now the embodiment of grace and beauty. Your Charisma score increases by 4, to a maximum of 24. Additionally, your body no longer appears to age, and you cannot be aged magically, however you may still die of old age.

subclass.name: Dance College of the Twirling Blade
subclassFeatures: Dance College of the Twirling Blade|Dancer|WOR|Blade|WOR|3

subclassFeature.name: Dance College of the Twirling Blade
entries: Dancers of the College of the Twirling Blade pride themselves on their combat capabilities being above most other dancers, twirling and lunging with their bodies as well as their blades.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: At 3rd level, when you choose this archetype, you gain proficiency in martial weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you gain access to a specific style of fighting to augment your skills. You cannot take a Fighting Style more than once, even if you can later choose again.

subclassFeature.name: Archery
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Defense
entries: While you are not wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

subclassFeature.name: Dueling
entries: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

subclassFeature.name: Mariner (UA)
entries: As long as you are not wearing heavy armor or using a shield, you have a swimming speed and a climbing speed equal to your normal speed, and you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

subclassFeature.name: Two-Weapon Fighting
entries: When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Starting at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Action Surge
entries: Starting at 10th level, you can push yourself beyond your normal limits for a moment. On your turn, you can take one additional action. Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you may use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Momentum Master
entries: Starting at 10th level, when you miss with a melee weapon attack, you may use your bonus action to immediately make another melee weapon attack.

subclassFeature.name: Dance of War Magic
entries: At 14th level, when you use your action to cast a spell, you may use your bonus action to make a weapon attack.

subclassFeature.name: Dance College of the Emblem
entries: Dancers of the college of the emblem are those that typically have served in a mercenary band, a military group, or some other similar force, and use their dancing dances to support others on the battlefield.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: Starting at 3rd level, when you choose this archetype, you gain proficiency with medicine and shields.

subclassFeature.name: Aegis of the Army
entries: Additionally at 3rd level, your Unarmored Defense feature from this class still applies when you have a shield equipped.

subclassFeature.name: Inspired Performance
entries: At 3rd level, you gain 2 cantrips from the bard spell list and one 1st level spell from the bard list that you can cast once per long rest. This 1st level spell does not count against your spells known and does not use a spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: Gracious Aid
entries: Starting at 5th level, your performance can inspire others. As an action, you may inspire one creature within 15 feet of you. The creature may use their reaction to move up to their movement speed and make an action they would normally be able to make on their turn. You have one use of this feature, gaining an additional use at 14th level. After using this feature, you must take a short or long rest before doing so again.

subclassFeature.name: Angelic Dancing
entries: Beginning at 10th level, as an action, you may expend a spell slot of 1st level or higher to begin dancing to channel a healing spell. You may choose a creature within 15 feet of you to restore {@dice 1d8} hit points per slot level expended, plus additional hit points equal to your Charisma modifier. As a bonus action, you may restore the hit points of one creature within 15 feet of a target to restore hit points equal to half the amount restored to the original creature.

subclassFeature.name: Adrenaline Dance
entries: Beginning at 14th level, you inspire others with your performance so fervently that their bodies react with great passion. As an action, you may choose a number of creatures equal to your proficiency bonus of your choice within 15 feet of you to be given the following effects: each chosen creature gains 2d8 temporary hit points, gains advantage on its next {@dice d4} attack rolls, and its proficiency is doubled for all skills the creature is proficient in for its next {@dice d4} ability checks. These effects last up to an hour.
After using this feature, you gain one level of exhaustion, and you may not use it again until after your next long rest.

entries.name: Concentration
entries: No

entries.name: Active
entries: As an action, you can expend a spell slot to unleash a dragon's breath. The breath has a range of either a 15-foot cone, or a 20 by 5-foot line, and creatures in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking half damage on a success. The damage is equal to {@dice 2d6} per level spell slot expended, to a max of 10d6. The damage type may be either poison, acid, fire, cold, or lightning.

entries.name: Passive
entries: While you have Dance of the Dragon active, you gain resistance to the damage type you used for the active effect and one other of your choice among the original choices. You may re-elect the types each time you use the active effect.

entries.name: Concentration
entries: No

entries.name: Active
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one spell slot to deal necrotic damage to the target, in addition to the weapon's damage. The extra damage is {@dice 2d8} for a 1st-level spell slot, plus {@dice 1d8} for each spell level higher than 1st, to a maximum of 6d8.

entries.name: Passive
entries: While you have Dance with Death active, you deal an additional {@dice d4} necrotic damage on all weapon attacks and gain advantage against saving throws that would frighten you.

entries.name: Concentration
entries: No

entries.name: Active
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend a spell slot to cast misty step, but target a number of creatures within 30 feet of yourself (including yourself) equal to the slot level to bring with you. The creatures you bring with you are placed within 5 feet of you.

entries.name: Passive
entries: While you have the Shifting Sand Salsa active, you have the effects of a 1st-level armor of agathys spell cast on yourself, which refreshes at the start of each of your turns. However, the damage is slashing damage, instead of cold.

entries.name: Concentration
entries: No

entries.name: Active
entries: As an action, you can expend a spell slot to conjure floating spectral troll arms. You conjure a number of arms equal to the spell slot level expended. You make a number of melee spell attacks on creatures within 15 feet of you equal to the number of troll arms summoned. Each attack deals slashing damage equal to {@dice 1d10} plus your Charisma modifier.

entries.name: Passive
entries: While you have the Tango of the Troll active, you regain hit points equal to half your dancer level (rounded up) at the start of each of your turns. If you take fire or acid damage, this doesn't function at the start of your next turn. You do not gain temporary hit points if you gain more health than your hit point maximum.

entries.name: Concentration
entries: No

entries.name: Active
entries: As an action, you can expend a spell slot to fill yourself with beast-like adrenaline, causing you to pounce on a creature within range of your movement speed, making a melee weapon attack on the creature, using your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier. On a hit, the creature is knocked prone and takes slashing damage equal to {@dice 1d8} per slot level plus your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier.

entries.name: Passive
entries: While you have the Waltz of the Pouncing Feline active, you have claws on your hands, causing your unarmed strikes to deal {@dice 1d6} slashing damage, and allow you to use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier if you so choose with them. If you use your action to make an unarmed strike, you can use your bonus action to make another unarmed strike, adding your modifier to the bonus action even if you do not possess the Two-Weapon Fighting fighting style.

entries.name: Concentration
entries: Yes

entries.name: Active
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend a spell slot to grow wings and dash forth up to 30 feet. Creatures within 5 feet of you in the path you dash make Dexterity saving throws, taking {@dice 1d8} slashing damage per slot level used on a failure, and half on a success.

entries.name: Passive
entries: While you have the Dance of the Avian active, you have a flight speed of 30 feet. You cannot wear medium or heavy armor with this active and must land at the end of each of your turns.

entries.name: Concentration
entries: No

entries.name: Active
entries: As an action, you can expend a spell slot to give yourself spectral horns that disappear after you ram with them and ram a creature within range of your movement speed, forcing a Dexterity save on the creature you target. On a failed save, the creature takes {@dice 1d12} bludgeoning damage per slot level, and is knocked prone, taking halfdamage and not being knocked prone on a success.

entries.name: Passive
entries: While you have the Mountain Goat Mambo active, you have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Concentration
entries: Yes

entries.name: Active
entries: As an action, you can expend a spell slot to give yourself the ability to levitate, as per the levitate spell. You may cast this spell on other creatures as well, equal to the level of spell slot expended.

entries.name: Passive
entries: While you have the Elevated Quickstep active, your jump height and distance are doubled and you gain advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks related to jumping.

entries.name: Concentration
entries: Yes

entries.name: Active
entries: As an action, you can expend a spell slot to cast Bless on a number of allies equal to the level of spell slot + 1 in range for 1 minute.

entries.name: Passive
entries: While you have the Dance of the Blessed active, those blessed gain an increase to their hit points and hit point maximums equal to your Charisma modifier + proficiency + spell slot level.

entries.name: Concentration
entries: Yes

entries.name: Active
entries: As an action, target an ally's  and expend one spell slot. Their next attack will deal extra (acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder) damage to their target, in addition to the weapon's damage. The extra damage is {@dice 2d8} for a 1st-level spell slot, plus {@dice 1d8} for each spell level higher than 1st, to a maximum of 6d8.

entries.name: Passive
entries: The targeted ally's weapon does {@dice d4} of extra (acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder) damage on all weapon attacks after the initial attack.

entries.name: Concentration
entries: No

entries.name: Active
entries: As an action, give a number of allies equal to the level of spell slot expended within 15 ft of you advantage on their attack rolls for their next turn, but enemies will have advantage on their attacks against these targets

entries.name: Passive
entries: The targets take half damage from your choice of slashing, bludgeoning, or piercing damage.

entries.name: Concentration
entries: No

entries.name: Active
entries: As a bonus action, you begin a special dance that loosens your motion and allows you to evade attacks easier, giving you the benefits of the Dodge action until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Passive
entries: You gain a bonus to your AC equal to the level of spell slot expended. Additionally, if you attack a creature that is benefiting from the Dodge action, you ignore those benefits as you match the rhythm of their evasive maneuvers.

entries.name: Concentration
entries: No

entries.name: Active
entries: As an action, a number of hostile creature equal to the level of spell slot expended within 15 feet of you that can see you must make a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the targets are charmed by you for the next minute. On a successful save, the targeted creatures aren't charmed. A creature who is charmed is able to repeat this saving throw at the beginning of each of their turns, ending the effect on the success. When a creature is no longer charmed, they realize that they have been duped, and become hostile to you.

entries.name: Passive
entries: You and your allies gain advantage on attack rolls against creatures charmed by this effect, but if a charmed creature is attacked by you or your allies, regardless of hitting or missing, the effect ends.

entries.name: Concentration
entries: No

entries.name: Active
entries: As an action, a number of hostile creatures equal to the level of spell slot expended within 15 feet of you that can see you must make a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the targeted creatures subtract your proficiency bonus from all attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws against you, your spells, and effects they make during the next {@dice d4} rounds. On a successful save, they resist this effect.

entries.name: Passive
entries: Your anxious dance disconcerts your enemies. Hostile creatures within 15 feet of you are considered to be in difficult terrain.

entries.name: Concentration
entries: No

entries.name: Active
entries: As a reaction, expend a spell slot to begin a special dance as a creature makes an attack against you. Whether they hit or miss, move half your movement speed. This movement doesn't trigger opportunity attacks. If they hit, you have resistance against the damage. You may choose to do so after the attack roll but before you know the result. You may use this reaction a number of times equal to the level of spell slot expended until the start of your next turn but cannot use any other reactions.

entries.name: Passive
entries: If you make a melee attack against a creature, that creature can't make opportunity attacks against you for the rest of the turn.

entries.name: Concentration
entries: No

entries.name: Active
entries: When you are attacked by a creature within 30 feet of you, expend a spell slot to use a reaction to reduce the damage taken from bludgeoning, force, lightning, or thunder damage equal to a number of d8s equal to the level of spell slot expended. Additionally, the creature that attacked you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or take lightning or thunder damage equal to a number of d8s equal to the level of spell slot expended + your charisma bonus.

entries.name: Passive
entries: After the initial attack, you gain resistance to lightning and thunder damage and deal an extra {@dice d4} of your choice of lightning or thunder damage with your weapon attacks.

entries.name: Concentration
entries: No

entries.name: Active
entries: As an action, expend a spell slot to create a trail of flames of a length equal to or less than your movement speed. Any creature that enters or start its turn inside the trail must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, its movement speed is halved and it takes fire damage equal to a number of d8s equal to the level of spell slot expended plus your charisma bonus. On a successful save, it takes half the fire damage and its speed isn't halved. The trail fades at the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Passive
entries: After creating the trail, you have resistance to fire damage and deal an extra {@dice d4} of fire damage with your weapon attacks.

entries.name: Concentration
entries: No

entries.name: Active
entries: When a hostile creature successfully attacks you, expend a spell slot to use your reaction to cause the ground beneath and around them to erupt with ice, causing icicles to sprout around them. The area within 5 feet of them becomes difficult terrain, and they must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or take cold damage equal to a number of d6s equal to the level of spell slot expended + your charisma bonus. On a successful save, they take half the damage.

entries.name: Passive
entries: After creating the ice, you have resistance to cold damage and deal an extra {@dice d4} cold damage with your weapon attacks.

subclass.name: Dance College of the Twirling Blade

entries.name: Concentration
entries: No

entries.name: Active
entries: As an action, expend a spell slot to begin an irresistible dance. A number of creatures equal to the level of spell slot expended (rounded down) within 15 feet of you that can see you must make a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the targets begin to dance uncontrollably, as per the spell Otto's Irresistible Dance unless they are immune to being charmed. On a successful save, the targeted creatures aren't charmed.

entries.name: Passive
entries: Your dance moves beckon others to join you. When a creature that can see you an enters or starts its turn in a 15-foot radius of you must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failure, they must choose one among moving, taking an action, taking a bonus action, or taking a reaction. On a success, they resist this effect and are immune to it for 1 hour.
